title: fizzbuzz challenge
description: write a program that prints numbers 1 to 100. for multiples of 3, print 'fizz', and for multiples of 5, print 'buzz'.
instructions: implement logic to check divisors and print appropriate strings.
solution: for (let i = 1; i <= 100; i++) { console.log(i % 3 === 0 ? (i % 5 === 0 ? 'FizzBuzz' : 'Fizz') : i % 5 === 0 ? 'Buzz' : i); }

title: palindrome checker
description: write a function to determine if a string is a palindrome.
instructions: implement logic to check if a string reads the same backward and forward.

title: binary search
instructions: the function should find a target value in a sorted array.
solution: int binarySearch(int arr[], int size, int target) { int left = 0, right = size - 1; while (left <= right) { int mid = left + (right - left) / 2; if (arr[mid] == target) return mid; else if (arr[mid] < target) left = mid + 1; else right = mid - 1; } return -1; }

title: factorial calculator
description: write a program to compute the factorial of a number.
instructions: use recursion or loops to calculate factorial values.
solution: int factorial(int n) { return n == 0 ? 1 : n * factorial(n - 1); }

title: prime number checker
description: write a function to check if a number is prime.
instructions: implement logic to determine primality of a given number.
solution: function isPrime(n) { if (n <= 1) return false; for (let i = 2; i <= Math.sqrt(n); i++) { if (n % i === 0) return false; } return true; }
